body.description: If you knew exactly what dystopian catastrophe scenario was in your future, how would you prepare? What would a survival and prepping expert do? Meet Jacob Mooreland, Prepper, Homesteader, and Combat Veteran, as he fights to save his family and farm from a Catastrophic Global Societal Collapse. Jacob, Former Army Ranger, and His Beautiful Wife Ana, the fierce daughter of a Croatian Sniper, have prepared their family for every contingency. Or have they?? Jacob and Ana are masters of self-reliance and experts of both off grid survival homesteading and self-defense. Their intriguing global connections grant them an inside look at the sinister geopolitical maneuvers behind the calamitous events and a first row seat to observe the seismic forces of this terrifyingly plausible scenario. See how they fend off one disaster after the next as they witness the perfect storm of the Global Collapse.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars What a terrific read.
reviews.reviewText: The author places the reader in the moment like an observer who is actually present in every moment of the story. What a movie this would make. Having read many apocalyptic and survival books I can say this was the best I’ve encountered. In a lot of books the characters are not well defined early on so you don’t connect as well as you do with this reading. The detail for each character is intense and you feel as if you know them personally. I noted particularly the emotions and mental calculation going on in his brain as a long serving Veteran myself as he encounters each situation. It was easy to think in tandem with him and reach the same understandings and action I would have taken. Saeclum is a well designed and engineered book that helps a new to apocalypse and even an old veteran feel the need to be more prepared especially in this broken world we live in today. To quote an old military motto, Semper Paratus, which means Always Ready, is an ever important thing to do. We live in troubled times, take heed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Take notes. Take lots of notes.
reviews.reviewText: The author has the real world experience and know how to have written this book. I found myself stopping many times to make a note for my own future use. I especially enjoyed that there was no unnecessary use of profanity or violence for the sake of violence. When an action of violence is used you understand why and the ramifications of that action. Many many good things to say about this book and author. I only have one complaint… I can’t wait to read book 2. Well I guess that isn’t a complaint as much as it is an encouragement for the writing of the next book. AATW! RLTW!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Not just a great story of what could possibly happen, but great ideas on how to prepare and possibly survive .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I needed a break from a 12 book series I’m reading, and a 7 book series, so far.Read in a couple sittings. Good pacing, not particularly original, but kept me interested.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great fast read
reviews.reviewText: Saeculum is a fast-paced, well thought out story. It is full of well thought out plans and ideas. Can't wait for the next book to come out.
